metadata.synopsis: After the goblin hunt celebration party (whether the player helped the goblins or the tieflings), Astarion has made arrangements to get intimate with the player at night. For Astarion, this is a game of power - one he's played many times before in the taverns of Baldur's Gate, trying to lure people back to his master. He's an old hand at seduction, very self-assured at first, but the player might not go along with the script he expects them to follow. The next morning, the player wakes to see Astarion standing and getting dressed. They catch a glimpse of scars on his back - a sore point. The scars were carved into him by his old master. As far as Astarion knows, they're a poem, but he's never been able to read it (can't look in a mirror, after all).

164.speaker: Astarion
164.text: There you are. I've been waiting.
164.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player walks through the forest, Astarion emerges from the shadowsNodeContext: Walking forward, out of the shadows

197.text: Waiting since the moment I set eyes on you.

74.context: NodeContext: Very close to the player

260.speaker: Astarion

18.speaker: Astarion

251.speaker: Player
251.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Astarion smiles, turns and lays the player down on the ground in one motion. Kissing their player on their chest, then the side of their rib. The player turns onto their side and Astarion slides in behind, ending with one long, kiss on the small of their neck before slideing his hand over the spot he kissed and inserting himself. The player responds with pleasure and their hand comes up to cover Astarions. Cut wide to show the imbrace, then a cloud passing over the moon.

242.speaker: Player
242.text: Relax. Enjoy yourself. Trust him not to bite you.

248.text: I told you that I was a magistrate in Baldur's Gate, but that's only part of it.

200.speaker: Astarion
200.text: The mind flayers weren't my first kidnapping. A long time ago, I crossed Cazador - a powerful man in Baldur's Gate.

14.speaker: Astarion
14.text: He captured me. Kept me for years as his slave.

190.speaker: Player
190.text: And he gave you those scars?

182.speaker: Astarion
182.text: Yes. It's a poem. My old master considered himself quite the artist.

257.speaker: Astarion
257.text: Cazador said the scars were his gift. A poem to carry with me.
257.context: NodeContext: A little grimly. Not a happy topic

97.speaker: Astarion
